title: Get rid of those remotes
comment: Easy to configure. Enable the remote network control on the front-end and it works... Simple

title: Could use some better documentation but great app!
comment: Only just got it working but seems to work great. Few notes: 1. It will be much easier if the frontend you want to control has a fixed IP. 2. Make sure you check "Enable Network Remote Control Interface" in the frontend General settings. 3. I have a Mythbuntu combined backend/frontend. I had to change the backend IP to the actual IP address of the system instead of the default 127.0.0.1 4. The Mythbuntu Control Center has a check box to enable Android & iOS remotes. There is currently a bug where this doesn't do anything. It doesn't seem to affect anything though.

title: Awesome Awesome and.. Awesome!!
comment: Forget regular remotes. The kids lose them anyway. I usually have my phone when I watch TV so this is great. I did have a small issue but worked through it fairly easy. There was a box in the Myth frontend general setup that was not checked on my frontend that allows network control. I checked it and connected fine after that.

title: Throw away your old remote
comment: Once you use this you won't need it

title: Works great!
comment: Easy to set up and works great on mythbuntu 14.  New skin would be awesome though, like make it look like a real remote with black background.  The white is distracting in a dark room.  Great job!

title: Screenshot need, but great remote
comment: Seriously great remote for using MythTV. Would be nice to have a dynamically updated screenshot after each button press (tap).

title: Io exception.  Tried all solutions won't work

a great indispensable app

title: Works well, easy setup
comment: Using a Samsung tablet, this was working in 5 minutes. The response is very quick and key repeat works well for scrolling lists of shows. I wish I had found it before I purchased an infred remote.

Saved me when my remote had batteries leak in it. Not as good as a well configured IR remote (especially my Logitech which controls multiple devices in the living room) but great as a backup and stop gap. Very easy to configure.  Except WOL isn't working for me... Tested WOL on front-end from laptop ok...

title: Up and running in 5 minutes
comment: Haven't used it for long, but was impressed by how easy it was to get working. From download to controlling my combined fe/be took less than five minutes.

title: Really useful
comment: It's great , although recently it's started taking a long time to load sometimes - frustrating if you just want to hit pause quickly! But overall it's a good app. Running on a HTC One

title: Install Tips
comment: To get this to work on Fedora, use ifconfig -a to get your ip & mac address, and use system-config-firewall to add an exception for TCP port 6546, and turn on network remote in frontend settings general.

title: Works very well once configured properly
comment: This app does a great job of controlling MythTV. It was difficult to configure. Did not find a lot of help online. Final Solution found through trial and error. Had to change IP address in myth TV back and to actual IP of the computer.

title: Need better icons
comment: I'd really like a cleaner icon for the app and more modern/cleaner/simpler button icons. App works great though.
Works well.

title: Fantistic MythTV Remote
comment: Been using this a long time and it's a great remote for a MythTV setup.

title: Really great app
comment: Works as described, never had an issue.

title: Great remote

title: Can't connect
comment: Looks nicer now but now I am getting the io exception fault issue and can't connect anymore.
Did the 1.8.5 update fix the IOException you were encountering?
Cannot connect to 0.26 and unable to troubleshoot. Is this great idea still live?

Check out the instructional video for setting up mythmote: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xr1cljto3OE

Also make sure your frontend does not have a firewall enabled blocking the incoming connection. Feel free to use the "email the developer link" in the google play store for additional support.

-Tom

comment: Main drawback is the heavy battery usage if left open.

Feel free to use the "email the developer link" in the google play store for additional support. -Tom

title: Just works!
comment: Make sure you turn on "network remote" in your frontend settings.

title: Sick of LIRC? Get mythmote!
comment: Although the interface is not *quite* as sexy as the Apple remote I've been using, it is more feature complete and it doesn't break every time there's a kernel update (curse you LIRC!!!!), so this is totally awesome!  Even better, it saved me having to buy a bluetooth adapter in order to pair my android phone to my htpc as a keyboard.   The only thing that could make this better would be a customizable 'favorites' tab that would let me choose only which buttons I needed. I don't use many buttons and it's slightly annoying to have to switch between 'navigation' and 'media' tabs for the handful of buttons I actually use (basically just arrow keys, select, volue, and rw/ff). Still less annoying than LIRC!!!

title: Works amazing! Avoid crashes
comment: This app works great, but will crash your frontend if you exit mythmote before the show you just selected stats playing. Just wait a few seconds before exiting the app and it'll never crash your frontend. Also it helps to start mythfrontend in a 'while' loop so it auto restarts if you forget and are impatient.

title: Excellent Remote for MythTV
comment: This remote application works great! I use it as my primary remote for my MythTV. A couple of ideas for enhancements I have are: -I'm moving my back-end to a rack in the basement running 24/7. I'll be adding a low power Zotac front-end to my TV. I'd like the ability to send a WOL command to my front-end, so it doesn't also need to run 24/7. -I'd love the ability to do some basic customization, such as adding or changing buttons, perhaps even basic macros.
Great app. Can you PLEASE make it so if you do a touch and hold, it repeats the keys? :)
